text: [ Groans ]
[ Yawns ]
Paul!
Hey, good morning.

What'd you do
with all my stuff?
Oh, uh, well, I hate clutter,

so I put all your paperwork
in folders

and I organized
your house.

But my house was already
organized --
organized confusion!
I had a system, Paul.

All the bills I can pay,
I put on this desk.

All the bills I can't pay,
I put in the trash!

"Better to keep yourself clean
and bright for you

are the window through which
you must see the world."
A fortune cookie?

Uh, "Real Housewives
of Atlanta," actually.
Oh.
Paul!

Where are my barbecue
spare ribs,

my macaroni
and cheese, okay?

What is this gluten-free stuff
and this organic stuff?

Yeah, I j-- I just did
a little quick shopping run.

It's good.
It's fresh stuff.

[ Spits ]
Oh.

Where's the sugar
in the soda?

Uh, you don't need
all those carbs

and high-fructose corn syrup.
No, no!

Paul,
you don't got to do that.

I don't got
to lose weight.

Actually, your cholesterol
is way too high.

I mean, did you read
what Dr. Lendhardt wrote?

My man, I don't listen
to the doctor.

I got knowledge, wisdom,
and understanding, okay?

I have the knowledge to know
I'm hungry.

I have the wisdom to know
to put them ribs

and some of them pig feet
in my stomach.

And I have the understanding
to know

I'm not supposed to eat 'em,
but guess what.
I don't give a [bleep]

Why don't you try a rice cake
and peanut butter?

No.
They're really good.

No, Paul.
I want to --
You don't got to do this.
I know, I kn...

I-I'm just -- I'm very used
to being a caretaker.
I get it.

I was a shook kid from Brooklyn,
too, man.

When Shay took my kids
to Jersey,

I've been feeling
a little lost myself.

But I know this is
an opportunity for me
to find out who I am.

And, my dude, you got
to do the same thing.
Yeah.

You're right.
No, I know, you're right.

This isn't -- I got to
get in touch with me.

I feel a lot better,
thank you.

Where you going?
I'm gonna bleach
your bathroom.
Goddamn it!
